issue.title: atlas_sim_interface_state needs timestamp (to debug bursty comms)

content.html:
added timestamp, see commit #59ded27.

In your AtlasSimInterfaceState subscriber, are you using tcpnodelay? If not, see this bit of code, enabling tcpnodelay may help you reduce the amount of jitter in network communication. For example, something similar to below:

  // ros topic subscribtions
  ros::SubscribeOptions asiStateSo =
    ros::SubscribeOptions::create<atlas_msgs::AtlasSimInterfaceState>(
    "/atlas/atlas_sim_interface_state", 100, SetAtlasSimInterfaceState,
    ros::VoidPtr(), rosnode->getCallbackQueue());
  asiStateSo.transport_hints =
    ros::TransportHints().reliable().tcpNoDelay(true);
  ros::Subscriber subASIState = rosnode->subscribe(asiStateSo);

John
